# Know Your Customer

  * Digital Identity

Validating and authenticating your customer’s identity

# Overview

Whether it’s for shopping, travel or banking, customers are increasingly using
their devices to get things done online. Many of these involve an initial
account setup, which can be time consuming – and in the past, it’s been
possible to set up accounts fraudulently using other people’s details.

## Key features

  * Check a customer’s identity quickly and securely during account registration or onboarding.
  * Get fast verification of a customer’s details when they’re buying products or services.

## Benefits

  * Increase business confidence that a customer’s identity is genuine.
  * Reduces costs with fewer fraudulent accounts being set up.
  * Speeds up account creation, as checks are carried out quickly and without customer intervention.
  * Requests sent to BT in real-time to a live database. 

## How does it work?

## Ideal for:

  * Authenticating a customer’s identity: 
    * A customer is shopping online and puts an item in their basket.
    * As a new customer, they need to register their details for the first time when paying.
    * The API performs a KYC check to compare the details given against the BT database.
    * The account will be created with a match of information, with the risk of fraud is minimised. If the details don’t match, further identity checks may be required.

## APIs Included

EE

BT

API docs by Redocly

# Know Your Customer (0.36)

This specification is available in Open API format:Download

Know Your Customer (KYC) match offers a mechanism through which a service
provider can submit end user (customer) information to validate such as name,
address, mobile telephone number to a mobile network operator for comparison
against their records. The mobile network operator will then confirm whether
these values match their records. The purpose being to prove the authenticity
of an end user, so long as the customer has consented to this.

## Get authorize

This resource is used by a service provider to initiate an OpenID/Mobile
Connect authorize.

**Sandbox responses**

The sandbox supports a number of success and failure scenarios which can be
simulated by using a MSISDN or PCR value listed in the tables below.

**Success scenarios** MSISDN | Sandbox response invoked | Description  
---|---|---  
447000543012 | 200 | Successful KYC match for EE PAYM customer.  
447000815077 | 200 | Successful KYC match for EE PAYG customer.  
PCR:a1109bce-5cee-4b1c-a36b-ac8f65ea3ecb | 200 | Successful KYC match for EE
PAYM customer.  
PCR:a1109bce-5cee-4b1c-a36b-ac8f65ea3ecb | 200 | Successful KYC match for EE
PAYG customer.  
**Error scenarios** MSISDN | Sandbox response invoked | Description  
---|---|---  
447884740574 | 302 | Any technical exception from backend service.  
447884740584 | 302 | SUBSCRIPTION_NOT_FOUND  
447884740590 | 302 | Status is not activated.  
447884740587 | 302 | MSISDN_NOT_FOUND  
447996121324 | 302 | Requested product is not in active state.  
447997045095 | 302 | Customer’s mobile account is not in active/partially
active state.  
PCR:01bfae5f-0047-44ec-9da3-dc837e | 302 | Requested PCR reference not found.  
  
##### Authorizations:

 _OAuth2_

##### query Parameters

client_id

required

|

string

Client identifier/API key of the partner.  
  
---|---  
scope

required

|

string

Space delimited parameters identifying the requested scopes.

The allowed scope combinations are: 'openid mc_kyc_hashed' and 'openid
mc_kyc_plain'.  
  
login_hint

required

|

string

This can contain either a plain text MSISDN, the encrypted MSISDN or a PCR
(Pseudonymous Customer Reference).

e.g. 'MSISDN:447700900999', 'ENCR_MSISDN:xxxxxxxx' or
'PCR:f70f33e4-64d7-49de-b7a6-51b560819b84'  
  
client_name|

string

A short application name as indicated in the Discovery API.

Alphanumeric characters are supported.  
  
response_type

required

|

string

This should always be set to 'code'.  
  
redirect_uri

required

|

string

The location where the authorisation server sends the user once the app has
been successfully authorised and granted an authorisation code or access
token.  
  
state

required

|

string

This parameter will hold the session information to echo back to the partner.

Alphanumeric characters are supported.  
  
nonce

required

|

string

A randomly generated value valid for a single session, to mitigate any replay
attacks.

Alphanumeric characters are supported.  
  
claims

required

|

string <json>

KYC Product: JSON containing the attributes submitted by the partner relating
to the customer.

The _name_ and _address_ values accept alphanumeric characters only.  
  
correlation_id|

string

This is optional, used to track unique transactions end to endpoint.

_correlation_id_ must be provided in UUID format (a 36-character alphanumeric
string 'XXXXXXXX-XXXX-XXXX-XXXX-XXXXXXXXXXXX').  
  
##### header Parameters

Content-Type|

string

The only supported format for the request body is 'application/x-www-form-
urlencoded'.  
  
---|---  
  
### Responses

 **302**

Found

**403**

Forbidden

Error | Message | Description  
---|---|---  
access_denied | Access denied | The _client_id_ / _redirect_uri_ is missing or
incorrect.  
  
**500**

Internal Server Error

Error | Message | Description  
---|---|---  
server_error | Internal error occurred | For any internal errors.  
  
get/v1/mobile-connect/authorize

Production

https://api.ee.co.uk/v1/mobile-connect/authorize

Sandbox

https://api-sandbox.ee.co.uk/v1/mobile-connect/authorize

###  Request samples

  * cURL

Copy

    
    
    curl -XGET https://api-sandbox.ee.co.uk/v1/mobile-connect/authorize?client_id=as87d8sa7d68sa7d&
    client_id=as87d8sa7d68sa7d&
    scope=openid mc_kyc_hashed&
    login_hint=MSISDN:447700900999&
    client_name=testclient&
    response_type=code&
    redirect_uri=https://mycompany.com&
    state=sdfdsfdsfds987f98sdfdsfdsf&
    nonce=34456456&
    correlation_id=b84e52fc-5b5d-4926-a6f3-42a4633d25e2&
    claims={"premiuminfo":{"nameHash": {"value": "2fd4e1c67a2d28fced849ee1bb76e7391b93eb12"},"nameMatch": {"essential": true,"values": ["Y-AV","N-AV","N-NA"]},"addressHash": {"value": "de9f2c7fd25e1b3afad3e85a0bd17d9b100db4b3"},"addressMatch": {"essential": true,"values": ["Y-AV","N-AV","N-NA"]},"firstNameHash": {"value": "de9f2c7fd25e1b3afad3e85a0bd17d9b100db4b3"},"firstNameMatch": {"essential": false,"values": ["N-AV"]},"lastNameHash": {"value": "de9f2c7fd25e1b3afad3e85a0bd17d9b100db4b3"},"lastNameMatch": {"essential": true,"values": ["Y-AV","N-AV","N-NA"]},"postcodeHash": {"value": "de9f2c7fd25e1b3afad3e85a0bd17d9b100db4b3"},"postcodeMatch": {"essential": true,"values": ["Y-AV","N-AV","N-NA"]}},"birthdate": {"value": "1984-07-26"},"birthdateMatch": {"essential": true,"values": ["Y-AV","N-AV","N-NA"]},"isLostStolen": {"essential": true},"billingSegment": {"essential": true}}
    

###  Response samples

  * 302
  * 403
  * 500

Content type

application/json

Example

Success, correlation_id sent in the requestSuccess, correlation_id not sent in
the requestSuccess, correlation_id sent in the request

Copy

`"Location:
{redirect_uri}?code=687324&state=4387598345h34uihiu&correlation_id=b84e52fc-5b5d-4926-a6f3-42a4633d25e2"`

## Token

The service provider can exchange a one-time auth code for an access token and
an id token, to call the premiuminfo endpoint.

**Sandbox responses**

This API resource is not deployed to the sandbox.  

##### header Parameters

Authorization

required

|

string

Example:  Basic <string>

To produce the Basic authorisation string, the app’s client ID, ‘:’ and
password are concatenated and base64-encoded. This string is prefixed with
‘Basic ’ e.g. 'Basic
Z2g3alowRWcyST4YXc5cmJDTGRBWkcxOGZkTkw6TTV5VFFFazFBcFRJMXBBVw=='  
  
---|---  
Content-Type|

string

The only supported format for the request body is 'application/x-www-form-
urlencoded'.  
  
##### Request Body schema: application/x-www-form-urlencoded

grant_type

required

|

string

The only supported value is 'authorization_code'.  
  
---|---  
code

required

|

string

An authorisation code returned from a successful authorisation request which
will be associated with the requested scope.  
  
redirect_uri

required

|

string

The location where the authorisation server sends the user once the app has
been successfully authorised and granted an authorisation code or access
token.  
  
### Responses

 **200**

OK

**401**

Unauthorized

Error | Description  
---|---  
access_denied | _Authorization_ basic value is incorrect or missing.  
access_denied | One of the following errors:  

  * _grant_type_ was not set to 'authorization_code'.
  *  _redirect_uri_ is not valid or is not the same value that was used in the authorize call.
  * Client credentials in the basic auth header are invalid. 

  
Invalid grant, access denied | Mandatory parameter code is missing or invalid.  
  
post/v1/mobile-connect/token

Production

https://api.ee.co.uk/v1/mobile-connect/token

Sandbox

https://api-sandbox.ee.co.uk/v1/mobile-connect/token

###  Request samples

  * Payload
  * cURL

Content type

application/x-www-form-urlencoded

Copy

    
    
    grant_type=authorization_code&code=Wo1BXkRz&redirect_uri=https://mycompany.com

###  Response samples

  * 200
  * 401

Content type

application/json

Example

Token responseSample decrypted Id token claims payloadToken response

Copy

`{

  * "access_token": "c333504b953d4a2fb82cd3584d030f2b",

  * "token_type": "bearer",

  * "id_token": "<JWT header>.<JWT payload containing claims>.<signature using client_secret>",

  * "expires_in": "1475744978"

}`

## Get premiuminfo

This resource performs a KYC check to compare the supplied details against the
stored customer details, to help reduce fraud.

**Sandbox responses**

The sandbox supports a number of success and failure scenarios which can be
simulated by using a MSISDN or PCR value listed in the tables below.

**Success scenarios** MSISDN | Sandbox response invoked | Description  
---|---|---  
447000543012 | 200 | Successful KYC match for EE PAYM customer.  
447000815077 | 200 | Successful KYC match for EE PAYG customer.  
PCR:a1109bce-5cee-4b1c-a36b-ac8f65ea3ecb | 200 | Successful KYC match for EE
PAYM customer.  
PCR:a1109bce-5cee-4b1c-a36b-ac8f65ea3ecb | 200 | Successful KYC match for EE
PAYG customer.  
**Error scenarios** MSISDN | Sandbox response invoked | Description  
---|---|---  
447997045095 | 302 | Customer’s mobile account is not in active/partially
active state.  
447996121324 | 302 | Requested product is not in active state.  
PCR:01bfae5f-0047-44ec-9da3-dc837e | 302 | Requested PCR reference not found.  
447884740574 | 302 | Any technical exception from backend service.  
447884740584 | 302 | SUBSCRIPTION_NOT_FOUND  
447884740590 | 302 | Status is not activated.  
447884740587 | 302 | MSISDN_NOT_FOUND  
  
##### header Parameters

Authorization

required

|

string

Example:  Bearer <token>

This contains the access token obtained from Token resource  
The access token is prefixed with the word 'Bearer ' to form the authorisation
string.  
  
---|---  
  
### Responses

 **200**

OK

**401**

Unauthorized

Error | Message | Description  
---|---|---  
Unauthorized | - | _Authorization_ header was not passed in the request.  
  
**403**

Forbidden

Error | Message | Description  
---|---|---  
access_denied | Access denied | An invalid access token was passed in the
request.  
  
**404**

Not Found

Error | Message | Description  
---|---|---  
not_found | Resource not found | The data requested cannot be found.  
  
**500**

Internal Server Error

Error | Message | Description  
---|---|---  
server_error | Internal error occurred | For any internal errors.  
server_error | Internal server error | The data passed to the downstream
system was invalid or missing.  
  
**503**

Service Unavailable

Error | Message | Description  
---|---|---  
temporarily_unavailable | The service is temporarily unavailable | For any
downstream errors.  
  
get/v1/mobile-connect/premiuminfo

Production

https://api.ee.co.uk/v1/mobile-connect/premiuminfo

Sandbox

https://api-sandbox.ee.co.uk/v1/mobile-connect/premiuminfo

###  Request samples

  * cURL

Copy

    
    
    curl -XGET -H 
    "Authorization: Bearer SZrYQsmi9tvGj1XwmKr5lXD4dpXY" 
    https://api-sandbox.ee.co.uk/v1/mobile-connect/premiuminfo
    

###  Response samples

  * 200
  * 401
  * 403
  * 404
  * 500
  * 503

Content type

application/json

Example

mc_kyc_hashed - address, firstName, postcode and birthdate matched, name not
matchedmc_kyc_plain - address, firstName, postcode and birthdate matched, name
not matchedmc_kyc_hashed - name matched, address and birthdate (not essential)
not matched. Only mandatory fields passed in the requestmc_kyc_plain - name
matched, address and birthdate (not essential) not matched. Only mandatory
fields passed in the requestmc_kyc_hashed - name and postcode matched, address
and birthdate not matchedmc_kyc_plain - name and postcode matched, address and
birthdate (not essential) matchedmc_kyc_plain - no matches foundmc_kyc_hashed
- address, firstName, postcode and birthdate matched, name not matched

Copy

`{

  * "sub": "5f90512d-972d-4def-bf90-9ef0ef2e5d2d",

  * "nameMatch": "N-AV",

  * "addressHash": "de9f2c7fd25e1b3afad3e85a0bd17d9b100db4b3",

  * "addressMatch": "Y-AV",

  * "firstNameHash": "96d9632f363564cc3032521409cf22a852f2032eec099ed5967c0d000cec607a",

  * "firstNameMatch": "Y-AV",

  * "lastNameMatch": "N-AV",

  * "postcodeHash": "d553aafeb07182de1968faf9a8f5a27c38d4444d75dbd7506dfd8b4475ffb4a0",

  * "postcodeMatch": "Y-AV",

  * "birthdate": "1984-07-26",

  * "birthdateMatch": "Y-AV",

  * "isLostStolen": "N",

  * "billingSegment": "PAYM"

}`

mc_kyc_hashed - address, firstName, postcode and birthdate matched, name not
matchedmc_kyc_plain - address, firstName, postcode and birthdate matched, name
not matchedmc_kyc_hashed - name matched, address and birthdate (not essential)
not matched. Only mandatory fields passed in the requestmc_kyc_plain - name
matched, address and birthdate (not essential) not matched. Only mandatory
fields passed in the requestmc_kyc_hashed - name and postcode matched, address
and birthdate not matchedmc_kyc_plain - name and postcode matched, address and
birthdate (not essential) matchedmc_kyc_plain - no matches foundmc_kyc_hashed
- address, firstName, postcode and birthdate matched, name not matched
